constituent: upright, magic wand, augury, divining rod, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight
heisigStory: Now take the last primitive, the shellfish, and set a magic wand over it, and you have the kanji for upright. After all, the clam and the oyster are incapable of walking upright. It would take a magician with his wand to pull off such a feat - which is precisely what we have in this kanji.
koohiiStory1: A magic wand is needed to make a clam stand upright.
koohiiStory2: Just the thought of my magic wand on her clam makes my magic wand stand upright.
myStory: đứng thẳng ngồi thẳng đứng thành trên con sò
